intro: Campylospermum striatum, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often have a slight waxy coating. Campylospermum striatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
